security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and configuration metadata. It provides guidance on code quality commands and standards without executing any code, making it safe for publishing.

content.value_statement: Code quality issues slow down development and introduce bugs. This skill provides immediate guidance on linting, formatting, and pre-commit validation using industry-standard Python tools.
actual_capabilities: Guide on running Black and Ruff for code formatting
Validate naming conventions against Python standards
Reference BasedPyright strict mode type checking
List quality standards including line length and rule categories
limitations: Does not execute commands automatically - provides guidance
Focused on Python code quality tools
Requires pre-installed development tools (uv, ruff, black, pre-commit)

output_examples.input: Fix the linting errors in my Python file
output: Run 'uv run ruff check .' to identify all linting issues
Common fixes: remove unused imports, fix variable naming, add type hints
Apply automatic fixes with 'uv run ruff check --fix .'
Review remaining issues manually and update your code
Re-run checks to confirm all issues are resolved

best_practices: Run linting checks before every commit using pre-commit hooks
Address linting errors proactively rather than suppressing them
Configure consistent quality standards across all team members
anti_patterns: Ignoring type checking errors in favor of 'it runs fine'
Skipping pre-commit checks to save time

faq.question: Which tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports Black, Ruff, BasedPyright, and pre-commit for Python projects.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with other programming languages?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on Python tools. Other languages may have similar tools with different configurations.

faq.question: Does this skill run commands automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance and commands. You run the commands in your terminal.

faq.question: How do I configure quality standards for my team?
faq.answer: Configure pyproject.toml with Black, Ruff, and pre-commit settings. Share the config in your repo.

faq.question: What if pre-commit hooks fail on my commits?
faq.answer: Check the error output, fix the issues locally, and retry your commit. Pre-commit prevents low-quality code from entering the repository.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude Code's built-in quality features?
faq.answer: This skill provides detailed guidance on tool configuration and workflows. Built-in features may have limited options.
